name: Test Table Creation
sql: CREATE TABLE Users (id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, username TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE, password TEXT NOT NULL, email TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE, created_at DATETIME DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP);
rationale: Ensure that Users table is created successfully.

name: Test Insert Users
sql: INSERT INTO Users (username, password, email) VALUES ('testuser', 'password123', 'test@example.com');

name: Test Insert Products
sql: INSERT INTO Products (name, description, price, stock_quantity) VALUES ('Test Product', 'A sample product', 10.00, 100);

name: Test Inserting Suppliers
sql: INSERT INTO Suppliers (name, contact_email, phone_number, address) VALUES ('Test Supplier', 'supplier@example.com', '1234567890', '123 Test St');

name: Test Insert Purchase Invoice
sql: INSERT INTO Purchase_Invoices (supplier_id, total_amount) VALUES ((SELECT id FROM Suppliers WHERE name = 'Test Supplier'), 500.00);
rationale: Check that the purchase invoice is linked to existing supplier.

name: Test Update Product Stock Quantity After Purchase Invoice
sql: UPDATE Products SET stock_quantity = stock_quantity + 50 WHERE name = 'Test Product';
rationale: Verify that product stock increases after a purchase invoice.

name: Test Validate Product Stock After Purchase
sql: SELECT stock_quantity FROM Products WHERE name = 'Test Product';
rationale: Ensure that the stock quantity reflects the increase after the purchase.
